title_review: Way Better Than It Looks From Outside
review_preview: First the most important, food is excellent. Second, the service is friendly and personal.Currently #3 out of all restaurants of Madrid, not the case. You can't compare this to Michelin star experience. They are not suppose to compete. It is not fine dining.There...
review_full: First the most important, food is excellent. Second, the service is friendly and personal. Currently #3 out of all restaurants of Madrid, not the case. You can't compare this to Michelin star experience. They are not suppose to compete. It is not fine dining. There are many great Indian/Nepalese restaurants in Madrid. I'm a huge fan of many. This goes high in the list. Ugly duckling with superb food. First look of the restaurant from outside doesn't look "that promising". Not the prettiest neighborhood either. If you go early, since they open 19:30, you are probably the only customer, but around 9pm people start coming and coming. I think the food and nice owner attracts the people. Menu has wider selection of things from all around India than any other Indian restaurant I have visited in Madrid. Prices are good average, but that makes the value for money very good. Location is good for people who live in Canillas and Hortaleza and can walk there. For people coming from further it's not the best location. Doesn't seem easiest place to park a car. Kind of nearby to Pinar del Rey metro though. Sodexo restaurant tickets are not accepted. I need to go more often to see if Excellent might be in place, but for now Very Good is definitely deserved.

review_preview: After spending more than a week in Spain, we were craving for some good curry and tandoori food. On arriving in Madrid, we decided to try out the Everest Tandoori as it ranked quite high in trip advisor list of recommended resturant a and boy...
review_full: After spending more than a week in Spain, we were craving for some good curry and tandoori food. On arriving in Madrid, we decided to try out the Everest Tandoori as it ranked quite high in trip advisor list of recommended resturant a and boy what a gem we discovered !! Right from moment we entered the place, (we were made very welcome by Krishna, probably the spirit behind the place) till the time we sampled the food it was a great experience. We ordered some vegetable pakoras as starters and then moved to Malai tikka and seekh kebabs plus chicken biryani and Chana masala. Everything has a distinct taste and was freshly prepared. Naans were soft and went perfectly with the mains. We finished off by ordering Mango Kulfi and Gulab Jaman and between them mango kulfi was a clear winner. In summary, great food coupled with outstanding service made this place a special experience for us in Madrid.

title_review: Great early dinner upon arrival in Madrid
review_preview: We arrived in Madrid around 5 pm on an overnight flight from Los Angeles so we did not want to wait for the usual dining time in Spain. We had done some online research in advance and made a reservation for 7:30 p.m. at The...
review_full: We arrived in Madrid around 5 pm on an overnight flight from Los Angeles so we did not want to wait for the usual dining time in Spain. We had done some online research in advance and made a reservation for 7:30 p.m. at The Spanish Farm, close to our hotel (Paseo del Prado). We were the only patrons in the restaurant until near the end of our meal. We started with a tomato ‚Äútower‚Äù with fresh tomatoes, creamy burrata, Atlantic sardines and olive tapenade. It was delicious! I order the mussels from Galicia for my main course. They were excellent. My wife had the Cod loin confit, slow cooked to perfection with a homemade tomato sauce and chive pesto. It was incredible. Melted in the mouth and the tomato sauce was superb. Our waiter was kind enough to draw a little map for us for some local sights that he enjoyed.

review_preview: This little restaurant is tucked into a side street off of Plaza de la Paja and if you're looking for something other than sitting outside, this is a great choice. The food was great (guacamole, salsa, tacos al pastor, and chicken enchiladas with mole sauce)...
review_full: This little restaurant is tucked into a side street off of Plaza de la Paja and if you're looking for something other than sitting outside, this is a great choice. The food was great (guacamole, salsa, tacos al pastor, and chicken enchiladas with mole sauce) but what made the evening was the experience itself -- the service was excellent, fun, and classy. They opened the door for everyone who left, brought extra chips just when it was needed, and were extremely accommodating of my food allergy (no dairy) and of my inability to speak Spanish (English menu and good humor). Would definitely recommend if you want a nice evening and delicious (and pretty) Mexican food in Madrid.

review_preview: Wow! From the minute we arrived we knew this would be a great evening. The venue has a perfect mexican atmosphere.This family driven restaurant is perfectly located close to the palace. They opened this restaurant 3 years ago, after running a simular place in...
review_full: Wow! From the minute we arrived we knew this would be a great evening. The venue has a perfect mexican atmosphere. This family driven restaurant is perfectly located close to the palace. They opened this restaurant 3 years ago, after running a simular place in Mexico for 23 years. We ordered a couple of margarites, a bit sweet after my taste, but good. I prefered the mexican beer. So - the food; we had nachos to share as starter. The guacamole and pico de gallo was perfectly done, and gave this easy dish a fantastic taste. The sauces were great. If you like it hot you should ask for the habanero sauce as well.  For main course we ordered tacos. We had one order with beef and one with lamb. The lamb was served with a very delicious mint jelly. The tacos were so great and gave the exact taste of Mexico. The family that runs this restaurant were so friendly, it felt like you had kown them for a long time when the dinner was over. We will definitely come back next time we visit Madrid.

review_full: My family and I traveled to Spain a few weeks ago and had a night free in Madrid so we decided to walk to the Retiro park. On our way, we passed a small restaurant that had just opened its doors for the evening. We looked at the menu and decided that we would return for a couple appetizers on our way back to the hotel from the park. We arrived about 8:30pm (early for Spain) and were seated at a corner table. The staff was excellent and very knowledgable. The food was so good we decided to stay for dinner. The Iberico ham was the best we tasted in Spain. The fish dishes were excellent! All three desserts were delicious but the highlight for me was the berry soup with a serving of coconut ice cream floating in the center. I asked more than once if I could have the recipe. No luck! Highly recommended!

We both chose the chicken fajitas and they arrived within 10 minutes to our table. They tasted fantastic and the homemade tacos really set the meal off. The staff were attentive and very friendly throughout and could not have been more helpful. Cannot recommend this place enough and would certainly return!

review_preview: We moved from London to Madrid 5 years ago and finally we found it - the most authentic Indian food with a special touch of Nepalese ingredients in Madrid!Quality/Quantity/Price of food is great. Waiters spot on all the time.We ordered everest steam momo,...
review_full: We moved from London to Madrid 5 years ago and finally we found it - the most authentic Indian food with a special touch of Nepalese ingredients in Madrid! Quality/Quantity/Price of food is great. Waiters spot on all the time. We ordered everest steam momo, butter chicken, pilau rice and garlic naan. Krishna suggested he would serve us a "surprise" lamb curry and we accepted....great choice! Few comments about some bad reviews we see here: Don't think there are fake reviews because it's really good. The location and neighbourhood is a bit strange and far from city centre, but who cares when food and service is great. Not for tourists that want to have a view on skyline of Madrid, but for people who love Indian food. It's a simple and not a posh restaurant. You can have food here for 45 ‚Ç¨ / couple or at Diverxo for 360 ‚Ç¨ / couple and be equally happy. Sure, it's a different experience.  It is not exactly like in UK, but it's the closest it gets in Madrid. A bit less spices, which makes sense because Spanish people don't like too spicy food. Tried more than 10 Indian restaurants in Madrid and every time we were disappointed. Forget restaurants in Lavapies unless you are only capable of ordering food based on pictures in the menu. This is now our favourite local restaurant- see you there ;-) Alex & Cristina

title_review: So nice we ate it twice
review_preview: Absolutely loved it, if you like Indian style food then you really can't miss this gem of a restaurant when visiting Madrid, it's off the beaten track a little but well worth the short taxi ride, me and my wife were staying in the Pio...
review_full: Absolutely loved it, if you like Indian style food then you really can't miss this gem of a restaurant when visiting Madrid, it's off the beaten track a little but well worth the short taxi ride, me and my wife were staying in the Pio XII area for the weekend and visited the restaurant on Saturday night after it was recommended to us, it was packed and we hadn't booked a table but they still managed to get a table together for us, we had a chicken tikka madras a chicken madras, two pilau rice, one butter nann and one garlic nann, just the basics really as we hadn't been before but it was one of the nicest curries we have ever had and I live in London where there are Indian restaurants everywhere that we regularly use. All the food that everyone else ordered looked really good too so the following day we decided to go back that evening and wasn't disappointed we did. We had a chicken curry, tandoori mixed grill, onion bhaji, two nann breads and a madras side sauce, we also had a large lager, large absolute vodka and two extra large Bailey's on ice after our meal and we were shocked when they bought the bill over at the end of our meal as it was only ‚Ç¨56.35 and that even included popadoms and dips. I am honestly looking forward to going back to Madrid to use this restaurant again not just for the beautiful food but the staff were very friendly without being to over attentive. We ate tapas in Madrid ever day and Indian/ Nepalese at night in The Everest Tandoori and it was just perfect. Thanks guys keep up the good work.

review_preview: Our best restaurant experience so far in Madrid. A short, but varied menu of simple, flavorful Spanish cuisine. We had turbot, pork loin and oxtail stew, all of which were delicious and reasonably priced. The standout dish was a sheep's milk cheesecake - a recent...
review_full: Our best restaurant experience so far in Madrid. A short, but varied menu of simple, flavorful Spanish cuisine. We had turbot, pork loin and oxtail stew, all of which were delicious and reasonably priced. The standout dish was a sheep's milk cheesecake - a recent creation by the chef.  The real highlight for us was the service - the owner, who speaks very good English, was charming and attentive throughout. The waiter was also very cheerful and did his best to communicate despite our lack of Spanish. The atmosphere was intimate and authentic - there was a sense that everyone genuinely cared about what they were serving. Much recommended if you are in the Prado area!

review_preview: Constant Companion and I were in Madrid for La Semana Santa. We wanted to go to The Spanish Farm last year but they were closed when we stumbled upon it. This time we made sure to make a reservation, especially since it was Easter! The...
review_full: Constant Companion and I were in Madrid for La Semana Santa. We wanted to go to The Spanish Farm last year but they were closed when we stumbled upon it. This time we made sure to make a reservation, especially since it was Easter! The restaurant/bistro is small with a very limited menu. But the farm to table freshness of the ingredients, the culinary skills of the kitchen, the great service, the genuine warmth of its owner Pedro, the elegant presentations, the funky modern ambiance, and the amble servings guarantee you a most enjoyable experience!!! CC and I decided to split the Goat Cheese Salad. I am not a big salad person but this was excellent and could easily be an entree for a light eater. CC selected the Vegan Paella for her entree and I opted for the Almond and Parsley Crusted Cod Loin. The cod was absolutely delicious and presented as nicely as any I have ever eaten. CC could not finish her Paella. She said it was SUPERB but there was just too much to eat. Pedro mistook this for dissatisfaction and immediately offered to make CC something else. You do not see that pride much any more! Obviously, there was not room for dessert. That will have to wait for our next visit! So if you are near the Prado be sure to have a meal here. It is really that good!!

Waiters did not seem professional, joking around in front of customers, making snide remarks Overall not a good expreience, if the food was good might have recommended it but the food was equally not good. review_preview: We just finished a most pleasing dining experience.  It was very easy to arrive at the Anton Martin Metro station, walk a very short distance on Calle Santa Isabel and find El Sur on a corner just a few blocks away.  Once inside, all of...
review_full: We just finished a most pleasing dining experience. It was very easy to arrive at the Anton Martin Metro station, walk a very short distance on Calle Santa Isabel and find El Sur on a corner just a few blocks away. Once inside, all of the staff immediately gave us a warm greeting. We arrived early enough (8:45 pm) to be seated right away. By the time we left, it was packed with people waiting. Hint: lots of people means it is a place for you to visit. There are English menus and the staff speaks English as well. We started out with a caprese salad and the musaka. Both were well prepared and tasty. For entrees, we had the chicken curry, salmon skewers, and a special garlic shrimp dish. Even though we shared everything, I can not pick one entre over another. They were all "the best". Alex suggested that we finish with a special dessert, but he wouldn't tell us what it was, but he promised we would like it. He was so right. We definitely liked it but could not really ID what it was. Not to spoil it for you, just tell him that you want the dessert that is creamy in texture and you already have a "passion" about it. Thank you Alex and the rest of the staff for a great meal. It was so good that we plan to return.

Extremely friendly staff! I'll be back for sure!

title_review: A Gem - great food and service!
review_preview: My daughter is pretty keen on Mexican food and so when we saw the reviews on Trip Advisor we had to find this place. Our cab driver was useless and couldn't find it so he dropped us off in the middle of La Latina but...
review_full: My daughter is pretty keen on Mexican food and so when we saw the reviews on Trip Advisor we had to find this place. Our cab driver was useless and couldn't find it so he dropped us off in the middle of La Latina but our trusty google map came in handy and we found it no problem. Small and cosy place, food was fresh and very tasty. I expected more spice but the sauce with the traditional taco was excellent and a cold beer to compliment was just the thing! The variety of tacos were delightful and the enchiladas very good. I'm not a dessert person but the guava in red wine was to die for and a great finish to the meal. Service was first class with smiles and patience at our very limited Spanish intersperced with English and sign language.Thank you for a lovely evening. We will definitely be back the next time we visit Madrid.

title_review: Good, but over priced & not authentic Mexican
review_preview: I have been to Madrid a few times and have eaten at 3 other Mexican restaurants in central Madrid. This by far is the worst of the 4 in total that I have been to. Firstly, true Mexican restaurants immediately place chips and salsa on...
review_full: I have been to Madrid a few times and have eaten at 3 other Mexican restaurants in central Madrid. This by far is the worst of the 4 in total that I have been to. Firstly, true Mexican restaurants immediately place chips and salsa on the table once sitting down. That is absolutely the standard. Tacos and tapas did no such thing. Also, the name of the restaurant is "tacos and TAPAS". There was no tapas delivered to the table upon ordering drinks, which is what normal tapas places do. I ordered three al pastor tacos and my friend has the carne enchiladas. They both were good with decent sized portions. The bill was 30 euro for two drinks and two entires, which is very expensive in a city like Madrid and for this restaurant. Overall, my friend and I left hungry and knowing that we would not be going back to this place.

title_review: A great meal with great staff!
review_preview: The staff members speak perfect English. They make their own baguette and give you a basket freshly sliced. You can order half portions of their main dishes so you can try many different dishes without getting too full. Prices are very reasonable!We came here...
review_full: The staff members speak perfect English. They make their own baguette and give you a basket freshly sliced. You can order half portions of their main dishes so you can try many different dishes without getting too full. Prices are very reasonable! We came here the first night in Spain, in Madrid and felt like we got a good intro into Spanish cuisine. It's a tiny place so keep your eyes peeled for the sign! Came at 7:30 pm on a Monday and it wasn't crowded yet. The staff was super friendly and attentive-- I told our server I was pregnant and sadly couldn't drink alcohol and at the end he surprised us and brought me a complimentary virgin apple liquer they make in house and my husband a fresh watermelon mojito shot that he shook up right at our table and congratulated us! The owner also made sure to check on us and see us on our way out to make sure we enjoyed our meal. So glad we read the reviews and decided to stop by for our first meal! Here is what we got and what we definitely recommend! -Grilled calamari (chipitones plancha)--huge juicy pieces prepped and cooked to perfectly so it wasn't rubbery but super tender.  - Prawns in garlicky butter sauce (gambon)- whole pieces of fried garlic with flavorful peeled prawns -musaka- looked like an eggplant lasagna when it first came out. But instead of pasta it has thin slices of potatoes like you find in gratin with thin slices of eggplant and spiced minced meat. Delicious!  - Cuban inspired shredded braised beef (ropa vieja)- it comes with either rice or homemade potato chips. we had it with both! They also make fresh cakes for dessert in house. we were stuffed and couldn't get to dessert but we'll definitely be trying it next time!

review_preview: We had a great experience dining at La Tragant√∫a! Very yummy food and quite accommodating service. Aside from being attentive at the table, my younger sister was a bit dehydrated from sightseeing in Madrid's summer heat earlier in the day and had to step outside...
review_full: We had a great experience dining at La Tragant√∫a! Very yummy food and quite accommodating service. Aside from being attentive at the table, my younger sister was a bit dehydrated from sightseeing in Madrid's summer heat earlier in the day and had to step outside as we were ordering. The servers were attentive to her--actually unlike anything I've ever seen! They went outside to check on her, and brought her a restaurant chair, water and bread to help her recover as she got some fresh air, and then insisted we rearrange so she was sitting by the air conditioning. They actually even brought my dad a beer outside as he was waiting outside with her! Then they both returned inside for a wonderful, delicious meal! All of the ingredients were very fresh and preparations were incredible. La Tragant√∫a is a very quaint/hole-in-the-wall type restaurant and is one of the most charming I've eaten in after a year living in Madrid. We loved our whole experience and were pleasantly surprised by the servers' clear passion for both their restaurant and for the dining experiences of their customers.  Definitely make a reservation! It's a small place which, as mentioned above, contributes to the lovely atmosphere.

title_review: Not bad by any stretch, just slightly dissappointing
review_preview: We went to La Tragantua on our first night in Madrid, and while it was a pleasant experience, it wasn't really worth a special trip from our hotel near Plaza de Espana. The restaurant is tiny - perhaps 6 tables total - and reservations are...
review_full: We went to La Tragantua on our first night in Madrid, and while it was a pleasant experience, it wasn't really worth a special trip from our hotel near Plaza de Espana. The restaurant is tiny - perhaps 6 tables total - and reservations are an absolute necessity as we saw no fewer than 4 groups turned away during our dinner. The owner and the rest of the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating, and the service overall was excellent. The food was good but nothing special - as others have noted the French Burger is not to be missed and the definite highlight of the meal with its caramelized onions and giant wedge of brie. If you're in the area then La Tragantua is certainly worth a look, but with so many excellent options in Madrid it probably shouldn't be at the top of your list.

title_review: Excellent Mexican food - make sure you book!
review_preview: Would definitely recommend this little gem, and go again when we're back in Madrid!We went here for dinner and right from the start we knew it was going to be good. The staff were polite and lovely, and they spoke English. The menu isn't...
review_full: Would definitely recommend this little gem, and go again when we're back in Madrid! We went here for dinner and right from the start we knew it was going to be good.  The staff were polite and lovely, and they spoke English.  The menu isn't big, but there's more than enough to chose from. We ordered a beer and a margarita to start - the cocktail was divine and so big it lasted the whole meal.  We had the nachos and quesadilla for starters, and they're the best nachos we've ever had. Well balanced and not too spicy.  We had beef and chicken tacos to share for the main, which were lovely. The tortillas are great!  All in all a great Mexican meal - I'd definitely recommend it and would go again.

review_full: Only 10 minutes away from Plaza Mayor, this mexican restaurant offers excellent food. The staff are very friendly and speak excellent English. Classic nachos, vegetarian tacos, chicken fajitas and beef enchiladas were all very good, if a little loaded with melted cheese. Menus were provided in English and service was fast and courteous. Booking is essential as the restaurant is quite small and intimate. Well worth a visit.

review_preview: We were in Madrid for the Champions League and decided we would slip away from the main Square for a spot of lunch and from previous reviews on Tripadvisor we chose this Mexican Restaurant, and what a great decision it was. As it was mid-afternoon...
review_full: We were in Madrid for the Champions League and decided we would slip away from the main Square for a spot of lunch and from previous reviews on Tripadvisor we chose this Mexican Restaurant, and what a great decision it was. As it was mid-afternoon the restaurant was actually empty when we arrived and this might have been a bit off-putting but as we had walked for 10-15 mins we decided to stay. The waiter was extremely helpful and welcoming, explaining the menu and recommending dishes. The food was fantastic 100% authentic Mexican and everything tasted so fresh. We also had some Mexican beers with our food which we had a mixture of Tacos, Nachos Con Guacamole (A Must have) & Enchiladas all delicious along with a desert, Passion Fruit in Red Wine which was very nice. A complimentary Tequila shot and some banter from our waiter to finish and a very reasonable bill at the end. Well worth the 10-15min stroll from Plaza Mayor!  I honestly couldn't recommend this restaurant highly enough.

review_preview: Perfect choice for "menu del dia" during weekdays in Madrid city center: 2 courses plus dessert or coffee, drink and bread for 13‚Ç¨. Maybe 1 or 2‚Ç¨ more expensive than average prices for "menu del dia", but definitely it is worth: not only for the...
review_full: Perfect choice for "menu del dia" during weekdays in Madrid city center: 2 courses plus dessert or coffee, drink and bread for 13‚Ç¨. Maybe 1 or 2‚Ç¨ more expensive than average prices for "menu del dia", but definitely it is worth: not only for the quality but also for the great variety they offer, with fusion dishes (they go beyond the typical first course "gazpacho" and second course "chicken with fries").  I enjoyed particularly the Salmorejo, a traditional dish of my hometown (C√≥rdoba): it tasted like the one my mom prepares! OUTSTANDING! I also tried the small burger and the thai chicken, both excellent choices.  The main problem of the restaurant is that is too small. Therefore, not only is complicated to get a spot, but also is a little bit unpleasant given how narrow are the tables. The service was excellent: nice and friendly waiters served our food very fast. Definitely I will come back during my next trip to Madrid!

title_review: The PERFECT authentic Mexican dinner date
review_preview: I can't recommend this restaurant enough. It is an excellent place for some Mexican tapas. It's just a short walk from the palace which is perfect placement. The restaurant itself is quite small which is perfect for a romantic meal for couples. It holds around...
review_full: I can't recommend this restaurant enough. It is an excellent place for some Mexican tapas. It's just a short walk from the palace which is perfect placement. The restaurant itself is quite small which is perfect for a romantic meal for couples. It holds around 6 tables which is small but the food was amazing and makes up for the size of the place. I would recommend calling to reserve a table before going though due to the size. My partner and I shared the nachos to start, they were top notch. The spicy salsa dip which came with them was to die for. We then ordered chicken fajitas and steak tacos to share. We both loved everything about our food. Upon getting our bill we were offered two shots of tequila on the house. I thought this was a wonderful gesture from the staff at this restaurant and it certainly was the perfect ending to a perfect night. All staff in the restaurant were also really lovely. They added to the amazing experience we had. We would definitely return.

title_review: A must-experience restaurant while in Madrid
review_preview: During an extended layover in Madrid, we channeled our inner Anthony Bourdain and cabbed it to La Tragantua based on the good word we had seen here. And we experienced one of the best meals of our entire Spain visit.Unfortunately, we didn't have reservations...
review_full: During an extended layover in Madrid, we channeled our inner Anthony Bourdain and cabbed it to La Tragantua based on the good word we had seen here. And we experienced one of the best meals of our entire Spain visit. Unfortunately, we didn't have reservations - but the staff was very, very friendly and was able to accommodate four adults for a late afternoon service. We agreed to come back and did. When we were seated, we realized why reservations are so necessary - we only counted 8 tables in this tiny establishment. The head waiter did a great job of trying to communicate with us in English as we tried to do the same with our high school Spanish. So if some of what I write isn't 100% accurate, it's because it got lost in translation. We ordered the brie cheese appetizer with jalapenos and sweet chili preserve (very good!) along with the daily special. Each one of us tried something different to get the full flavor of the place - and my only regret is that we just didn't have enough room in our stomachs to try more! With the daily special, we tried the cold tomato bisque (with hard-boiled egg slices & cured iberico ham chunks), melted cheese with roasted patron peppers (not spicy), salad with shrimp & calamari, and fried dumplings. The next course consisted of risotto, fried Hake fish, pork medallions and Thai chicken. It was all delicious - but we agreed the Thai chicken with rice was the tastiest. (BTW -- having never had Hake before - it was an interesting experience. Although it's a member of the Cod family, it has more of a crab-meat flakiness, than the cod you typically find in fish & chips.) For dessert, we tried this amazing pastry that was like the combination of a moist, mini-rum cupcake with a flan-like, custard topping that was something I had never tasted before! (What was that?) But it was awesome! All this with a bottle of wine, a beer, several other glasses of wine, an espresso... and our bill was only around $85! Since we were one of the last to be seated and the last to remain - we chatted with the owner and head waiter (who are brothers) and learned that "tragantua" means someone who overeats in Basque! Never once did we feel like we were imposing on their time - although it was way past closing time. We never got to thank the chef for the amazing meal - but we did tell the owner and brother that we loved their place. As I mentioned before - our only regret was that we couldn't order/try more of the delicious-sounding items on the menu. (Although we tried - and the waiter insisted that we would never be able to finish everything... he was right!) Another bonus to this restaurant is that's it's only a walk away from the famed Madrid Atocha railway station (Gare de Madrid). If you're traveling with children - this might not be the best place - because the food is very flavorful. (Although we did see a few families around.) But if you're traveling with friends and other adults, this is a must-see!

review_preview: Beautiful stunning little restaurant with a fantastic owner with great English. The starters were beautiful, the Korean pasties with chilli dip and the prawn & squid skewers were to die for, for main we had steak all cooked to different tastes, rare and medium well...
review_full: Beautiful stunning little restaurant with a fantastic owner with great English. The starters were beautiful, the Korean pasties with chilli dip and the prawn & squid skewers were to die for, for main we had steak all cooked to different tastes, rare and medium well done.. These we're all cooked to perfection, the chef in this place deserves a pay rise. The owner who was a fantastic host made the night the most enjoyable we have had as friends EVER (in the whole world). He clearly loved what he was doing. We will definitely be back if we are in the area in future. The bill at the end was exceptional too, for four people with starters and mains, 2 bottles of wine, 6 beers was just 160 euro, but it does depend on what you order. I'm just so pleased that we spent our last night in Spain in Madrid and went to this restaurant. Just read the trip advisor reviews!!! And go and enjoy yourself x

review_preview: My wife and I visited here last week based on good reviews.  We were not disappointed.  We were booked in for 21.30, early by Spanish standards, and there were not many people in.  There are only about 6 tables and the place was seemingly run...
review_full: My wife and I visited here last week based on good reviews. We were not disappointed. We were booked in for 21.30, early by Spanish standards, and there were not many people in. There are only about 6 tables and the place was seemingly run by just two people. I was obviously popular though as the owner had to turn away a steady stream of passers-by as all of his tables were booked. The food was lovely, as was the very large margarita. Service was brilliant. The owner was so polite and friendly. We were really made to feel welcome. Not surprising that they keep getting great reviews. I think the small scale of the place means they can really pay attention to detail and provide great service. We each had two courses and a drink and the bill was about ‚Ç¨65.

review_preview: Had booked online with tripadvisor and we had a special offer allowing us 30% off, but staff seemed unable to find our booking. I felt myself and my husband were not received very well and we saw none of the friendliness that other reviewers had...
review_full: Had booked online with tripadvisor and we had a special offer allowing us 30% off, but staff seemed unable to find our booking. I felt myself and my husband were not received very well and we saw none of the friendliness that other reviewers had commented on. Restaurant had just opened when we got there so there were only 2 other tables, it lacked a little atmosphere it got better when the other few tables filled up, I would suggest music in the background at the beginning of opening time to help this along. Food was very nice, I had fried green tomatoes with goats cheese to start whilst husband had skewered prawns and squid. For the main my husband had the Turkish style burger whilst I had the cod with black pudding - both delicious. We were too full for dessert. The main course came quite quickly after the starter and I did feel we were being rushed a bit. Looking around I felt that other tables were receiving much better service and I wonder if it was due to us having the special offer voucher. All in all it was nice food but nothing extraordinary

review_preview: To make it clear that you will get better food in Madrid but you won't get better value or friendlier service!!  Fine dining it isn't but the food is honest, well cooked, tasty and cheap.  We came here after walking in and out of Taberna...
review_full: To make it clear that you will get better food in Madrid but you won't get better value or friendlier service!! Fine dining it isn't but the food is honest, well cooked, tasty and cheap. We came here after walking in and out of Taberna Mas Al Sur which is round the corner (read my review). Alex the waiter (and the owner and all the staff) are all very very nice and make you very welcome. The menu is short and but we came two nights and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Alex told us all the raciones could be served in half portions which was great. Advised us to have four halves which we did. I was doubtful that this would be enough but he insisted that we would not want any more and he was right. All delicious. With good bread, a bottle of navarra red wine, one pudding and one coffee it cost 43 euro - great value. Came back next night but because we had a big lunch ate a lot less but still had a great time. Tip. Order one or two dishes at a time and keep going until you have eaten enough! if you go ask Alex how his finger is (he cut it breaking a glass on our table)!!

Muchos Gracias Pedro. You are the best :-) Rosa and Henry from Norway :-) :-)

title_review: Perfect for after Prado visit or dinner
review_preview: The Spanish Farm offered great food, wine and service for reasonable prices. Great authentic Spanish food  in a hip environment. The service was impeccable. The menu offered diverse options, from vegan to steak, small plates (tapas) or full entrees. We had corvina ceviche and burrata...
review_full: The Spanish Farm offered great food, wine and service for reasonable prices. Great authentic Spanish food in a hip environment. The service was impeccable. The menu offered diverse options, from vegan to steak, small plates (tapas) or full entrees. We had corvina ceviche and burrata cheese on a bed of tomato pure to start, followed by cod fish, steak, pork and a vegan lasagna; and finishing off with a Spanish version of chocolate mousse and cheesecake. Deserts were to die for. Friendly staff and owner - knowledgeable of all things Spanish food and wines - were at hand to explain dishes and cooking.

review_preview: I found this restaurant on TripAdvisor when I was searching for a romantic place for a dinner.I booked it and I must say we were pleasantly surprised: the place itself is quite small and quiet but with a warm atmosphere, the menu is not...
review_full: I found this restaurant on TripAdvisor when I was searching for a romantic place for a dinner. I booked it and I must say we were pleasantly surprised: the place itself is quite small and quiet but with a warm atmosphere, the menu is not long but every single dish looked quite appetizing. The meal was exquisite, everything was fresh, tasty and the recipes are quite original, it's a very modern take on Spanish cuisine. The service was really helpful, friendly and discreet at the same time. If you are looking for a very "filling" or are satisfied only by big portions, The Spanish Farm might not be the place for you, they seem to prefer quality over quantity. It is perfect for a romantic evening.

title_review: Excellent Dinner with interesting local ingredients
review_preview: We stopped here in early January after spending most of the day at the Prado.  This is a small restaurant and it was full.  They were still using their Christmas Menu which had many interesting items on it.  We did get the bread with the...
review_full: We stopped here in early January after spending most of the day at the Prado. This is a small restaurant and it was full. They were still using their Christmas Menu which had many interesting items on it. We did get the bread with the meal (it was excellent). The Artichoke cream soup as the starter was savory and warm (excellent). The Iberian Pork shoulder was tender and paired well with the potatoes and plum sauce that came with it (excellent). The Veal filet steak in the Madeira sauce was very good (to reach excellent it would have to have been plated with something else for contrast). The wine selection was excellent (lots of really good reds to choose from). For dessert we shared a chocolate pudding with pistachio ice cream and glass of a dessert wine (excellent)

review_preview: It was my last meal in Spain so i wanted it to be a bit special. I reserved a spot at the last moment on the fork for 9pm just incase but it was mostly empty at that time. I ordered a steak because it...
review_full: It was my last meal in Spain so i wanted it to be a bit special. I reserved a spot at the last moment on the fork for 9pm just incase but it was mostly empty at that time. I ordered a steak because it was my last meal there and the server recommended it... but should have known never order steak from a place that doesn't specialize in steak... they actually didn't ask me how i would like it cooked... i think the quality of the meat was good but it was wayy too rare for me (I usually like it medium rare or medium) - i kept on chewing and chewing and it was hard to eat because it was too rare for my taste (plus no steak knife). I think they cook it slowly over time but it just wasn't the doneness i preferred :( I asked it to be cooked to medium and they said it was medium already. They ended up cooking it more for me but then it ended up just being well-done which isn't my preference either... it was better than rare though so I didn't complain - i was too tired to go somewhere else and still not completely full so I ordered 1/2 order of a cod dish after the steak which was a lot better (cooked really well) but it wasn't mind blowing either. The portion for that was pretty good for 1/2 though. Steak full portion is 250g. I did like the interior a lot (super cute!) and the server was nice and attentive and let me try the wines before committing. It was nice and quiet so that was also a plus. This was my most expensive meal in Spain (38 euros with drinks so its not like super expensive but still :(((( ) i should have ordered the dishes people talked about on here instead.

title_review: The food is farm to table.
review_preview: This small modern style restaurant was a delight. The owner and one server took care of the 7 tables. We began the meal with fresh burrata that was creamy and delicious and a full bowl of mussels, larger than any I have ever seen. For...
review_full: This small modern style restaurant was a delight. The owner and one server took care of the 7 tables. We began the meal with fresh burrata that was creamy and delicious and a full bowl of mussels, larger than any I have ever seen. For the main course my husband order fish which he said was the best he had ever eaten. I opted for the duck. Lovely slices of duck meat, not gamey but with a rich flavor. For dessert we shared the cheesecake de turron de chocolate and a tartaleta frutos. The cheesecake was more of a mousse in a glass container with a layer of chocolate at the bottom and crunchy pieces on the top. The flavor of the cheesecake was too mild but the tarte did not disappoint. I would recommend Spanish Farm to anyone. It was a relaxing meal with very good food.

title_review: A very good find at great value
review_preview: We were looking for a restaurant around the Prado and the park that was not touristy and offered a different fresher menu.The Farm is located 5 minutes walk from both.  It is a modern restaurant very light with a big window but only 20...
review_full: We were looking for a restaurant around the Prado and the park that was not touristy and offered a different fresher menu. The Farm is located 5 minutes walk from both. It is a modern restaurant very light with a big window but only 20 or so covers so do book. We emailed ahead and Pedro was very efficient at replying and confirming. It is easy to walk past it so look out for it. There are a variety of starters all based around sea and earth and it is fresh as several fish dishes were unavailable. We had the squid ceviche, fresh burrata and red pesto and aged Iberico to start and the cod, a duck leg and I had the slow cooked beef fillet. They were all very well prepared with great flavours. We had two bottles of an excellent Albari√±o at only ‚Ç¨35 per bottle. Overall the whole bill was ‚Ç¨180 for four of us for everything which was very very good value for excellent fresh cuisine right in the centre of Madrid. A great find and we will go again!!

title_review: Exellent restaurant for visitors or locals
review_preview: First, the food.  Everything was excellent, Both the starters of burratta and mussels were fresh and flavorful, and the mains of beef, duck and turbot were all unique and cooked to perfection.  One of the best meals so far in Madrid, and we have been...
review_full: First, the food. Everything was excellent, Both the starters of burratta and mussels were fresh and flavorful, and the mains of beef, duck and turbot were all unique and cooked to perfection. One of the best meals so far in Madrid, and we have been to about 60 restaurants since we arrived here last year. Next, the ambiance. It is a great restaurant for US expats or english speaking visitors. If you want to eat before 9:30, you can find it difficult finding an open restaurant, and likely we will eating in an empty room. Here, we arrived at 8:30, and the small 10 table restaurant was almost full! The owner speaks perfect English, english menus, and friendly servers, as well as more "American paced" service - dinner can be had in 90 minutes if you want - make for a perfect meal in a comforting environment. The local crowd seems to arrive around 10pm. Highly recommended!

review_preview: We had the best food of our stay in Madrid here.  We found it while visiting the botanic gardens opposite and were looking for a place we could meet our vegan daughter - the vegan paella stood out so we booked a table for lunch....
review_full: We had the best food of our stay in Madrid here. We found it while visiting the botanic gardens opposite and were looking for a place we could meet our vegan daughter - the vegan paella stood out so we booked a table for lunch. It's beautifully decorated - quite arty with lots of wood and artefacts and interesting lighting. There are nice tables with proper linen and rush baskets with oil, vinegar and a proper pepper mill. It's quite small so I recommend booking to be sure of a table. We had lunch twice here and would have returned for dinner had we had time. The menu isn't enormous but what is there is varied and gives choice of fish, meat and veggie/vegan. The vermouth is lovely too. Olives with smoked salmon and cream cheese came gratis when we ordered - delicious and as my husband doesn't eat salmon, they brought some chorizo and breadsticks for him. We shared the goats' cheese salad which came with a wonderful sherry vinegar dressing, then ordered the vegan paella and mackerel with anchovies and green herb sauce with some gorgeous sourdough bread (extra). We had some beers and a vermouth with a twist of orange. Everything was beautifully presented, was fresh and delicious. Service was friendly, helpful and patient. Considering the quality of the food and d√©cor, we thought the prices no higher than most ordinary restaurants. Highly recommend.

review_preview: We were staying close to Atocha station and wanted to eat at a nearby restaurant. I found The Spanish Farm on Trip Advisor, which appeared suitable, and duly reserved a table for two on line.The restaurant is quite small but has a pleasant and...

The restaurant is quite small but has a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere with good friendly service. We both had the Iberian pork in plum sauce with couscous, which was delicious and very imaginatively presented. We shared the homemade coulant of chocolate for dessert, which was delicious. All in all, this meal was a real treat for our first night in Spain.

review_preview: We found The Spanish Farm because of reviews written here.  It met our needs: it offered authentic Spanish cuisine and was near the Prado museum.  We reserved dinner for two at 8pm; not quite authentic Spanish (meaning 9pm or after, later than the usual time...
review_full: We found The Spanish Farm because of reviews written here. It met our needs: it offered authentic Spanish cuisine and was near the Prado museum. We reserved dinner for two at 8pm; not quite authentic Spanish (meaning 9pm or after, later than the usual time most Americans eat), but close enough. The restaurant is located between the Prado and the Royal Botanical Gardens...a perfect location. We were welcomed cordially, and seated immediately. The restaurant is deliberately not ornate; it seats about 14 people at tables, and maybe another six at the bar. Menus are available in English; the staff speaks English as well, some better than others...but far better than my Spanish. We started off by splitting a salad with goat cheese and walnuts, after first ordering drinks. My wife ordered the sangria of the day, which was delivered with more cinnamon than she's used to. It was quite good, nonetheless. I got a glass of wine...and we split a bottle of carbonated water. Bread also was delivered to the table; it costs 1.5 euros per person...we didn't order it, but weren't going to raise a stink about it. The bread was quite good as well, and added to our overall enjoyment of the meal. From there, dinner was delivered. My wife had cod with a saffron sauce that she truly enjoyed. I had the Iberian chopped pork filet served over couscous with a plum sauce. I chose incredibly well. Both meals can easily be recommended. I finished with an espresso; the Spanish Farm, like many places throughout Madrid, serves Nespresso....it delivers a consistent quality of coffee. We didn't have dessert, because we'd gone to a chocolateria prior to dinner for a snack of hot chocolate and churros. Dinner was extraordinarily well priced, at less than 60 euros. My wife said that if we lived in Madrid, we'd be back again. I agree. My only suggestion to the owner is that the pacing on dinner might be spaced out a bit. We were out the door in little more than an hour; I didn't feel rushed at all, but a more leisurely pace might have worked even better.

A few food recommendations: the goat cheese salad (half portion) was excellent and more than enough for very generous helpings for my husband and me. The chocolate dessert with pistachio ice cream was simple and tasty. Just the right portion size, too. This is a place that is worth the trip.

title_review: Best Authentic Mexican Food for all outside of Mexico and US
review_preview: The reviews that say this place isn't authentic don't know what they're talking about. My wife and I live near the Mexican border, go to Mexico over 10 times a year, and have both lived in Mexico a year each. This place rivals the best...
review_full: The reviews that say this place isn't authentic don't know what they're talking about. My wife and I live near the Mexican border, go to Mexico over 10 times a year, and have both lived in Mexico a year each. This place rivals the best Mexican food from Mexico, Texas, SoCal and other border states. Why is that? Well, the chef is from Veracruz which is in Mexico. We've tried Mexican food in over 10 countries and while some taste delicious, they are not authentic Mexican. These places tend to make many Europeans think they're having authentic Mexican, when they're not.  Not only is the food delicious but the service is also amazing. I wish they ran their restaurant right next to my house because I'd go there all the time. Definitely make reservations because the setting is small and they focus on customer satisfaction over rushing customers. We didn't have reservations and got lucky to be seated. For the quality of food and service we found the pricing fair compared to other establishments in Madrid.

title_review: Great spot for a casual dinner - excellent food and atmosphere
review_preview: Visited for dinner with a colleague on a recent business trip to Madrid.  I selected Taberna el Sur based on TripAdvisor reviews and proximity to our hotel.  It was great.  The proprietor was very friendly and accommodated us at a table within 15 minutes of...
review_full: Visited for dinner with a colleague on a recent business trip to Madrid. I selected Taberna el Sur based on TripAdvisor reviews and proximity to our hotel. It was great. The proprietor was very friendly and accommodated us at a table within 15 minutes of arrival. We sat at the bar for a beer (and olives as the bar snack) while waiting. It is a small restaurant with a buzzing atmosphere and appears to be a favorite of locals (always a good sign). We shared several tapas (plate of jamon, shredded cuban steak; grilled calamari; shrimp in garlic butter; curry chicken). Finished it off with dessert (chocolate mousse cake and cheesecake). It was all delicious, and I topped it off with a couple of glasses of nice Rioja for under 3 euros per glass. Highly recommend a visit to this establishment if you are visiting Madrid.

title_review: Great atmosphere and even better food.

review_full: We found The Spanish Farm via TripAdvisor and it more than delivered. It is a small restaurant with a very good atmosphere. There is a decent wine list and a menu with just enough choice to accommodate for everyone. The staff speaks English very well, which shouldn't be a requirement but was nice anyway. As for the food the veal, both tartar and steak were marvelous and perfectly done (sous-vide?). The home made chocolate desert with vanilla ice cream was very nice as well. And at the end the bill was reasonable as well. Would definitely recommend for when you want more than just a simple meal in Madrid.

review_preview: We did an early dinner at The Spanish Farm and were the only ones in the restaurant for about 30 minutes at 7:30 pm.  The host and staff were fantastic, allowing my wife and her friend to taste various Spanish wines until they found the...
review_full: We did an early dinner at The Spanish Farm and were the only ones in the restaurant for about 30 minutes at 7:30 pm. The host and staff were fantastic, allowing my wife and her friend to taste various Spanish wines until they found the one they liked. I ordered Sangria and let me say it was awesome - we ended up ordering several more as the girls switched to my drink because of how good it was. The food can be served as an individual plate or for sharing. We did the latter, allowing each of us to enjoy the wonderful food creations they had. Everything was outstanding - we had mussels, ceviche, pork belly, pork tenderloin, beef tenderloin and the red tuna. A ton of food, all of which was fantastic. We hadn't kept track of the bill but when it came, we were pleasantly surprised at how reasonable it was. The chef also came out and talked to us about how the pork tenderloin dish was prepared. We couldn't have been happier with our meal and would highly recommend you give it a shot

review_full: We had a lunch here and the first impression was very good. Everything nice, new, clean and stuff very polite. Gazpacho was ok, but nothing fancy, cheese variations also ok, home made bread was tasty, but not spectacular. Codfish was fresh, well prepared, few bones were left in the fillet. Real highlight was the beef fillet steak, nicely aged, very soft, medium-rare done, it was literaly melting on the tounge. Demiglace well balanced, strong but not to salty, truffle on the top was little overkill. Definetly one of the best steaks of my live. Desert was tartelet with passionfruit filling as a recomandation from a waiter, it was nice but little too sweet. Coffe was a little disapointment with no foam and to much sourness to my liking. In the end we left all plates empty and as a conclusion 4 stars of 5 are well earnd.

title_review: A superb dinner, fantastic service, but there was a little but
review_preview: My friends and I went to Madrid for a weekend only so we really carefully selected a place for dinner. And taberna el Sur  was a great discovery for us with its close location to our hotel on Atocha, over 1200 mainly positive reviews and...
review_full: My friends and I went to Madrid for a weekend only so we really carefully selected a place for dinner. And taberna el Sur was a great discovery for us with its close location to our hotel on Atocha, over 1200 mainly positive reviews and reasonable prices.  Indeed the dinner was beyond our expectations!!! We came later then we booked for, but the manager of the place was really nice to rearrange the tables for us.  While we were waiting for our dishes they brought their homemade bread! Gosh! It's dangerous! We ordered two portions of it!  Both of my friends took salmon skewers and I went for our waiter's suggestion "Solomila Sur" which was a gastronomic perfection! Pork meat in a red wine sauce with baked potatoes! Completely new sweet-n-salty taste! And of course we got sangria which was another highlight of the place. And now come the lowlights of our experience in el Sur. After we had such an unforgettable dinner we decided to go there also for lunch next day.  In short:  1) the bread was from last night, but we were still ok with it 2) I suspect the same of the salmon skewer I took, as the cheese on top was so hard, that I hardly could cut it.  3) apart from the fact that the paella was not served in a pan and with a traditional crust, it was too salty and the portion was small So at the end we remained with a bit of the sour taste and the lunch made fade away our excitement from dinner.  The thing that a bit saved the situation was the fact that we did not pay for paella. And that we were proposed some digestive liquor.  So for conclusion, I can recommend the place, but only for dinner.

title_review: Might be terrific for evening meal, but beware of afternoon
review_preview: The fixed price 13 euro menu read well, but the sardine salad featured tinned sardines on lettuce with a sweet mayonaisse sauce. The Tai Chicken was chicken steeped in sweet chilli sauce, with some black pepper for piquancy. Beef ordered very very rare came out...
review_full: The fixed price 13 euro menu read well, but the sardine salad featured tinned sardines on lettuce with a sweet mayonaisse sauce. The Tai Chicken was chicken steeped in sweet chilli sauce, with some black pepper for piquancy. Beef ordered very very rare came out cooked to death (it was replaced, without apology, with a medium rare piece). No-one seemed knowledeable about the wines listed, and one we chose was unavailable. The place was busy so the poor service was excusable. However it was also charmless.  Patrons were predominately locals, the restaurant has great reviews and people were queuing, so our experience was presumably atypical. But we wished we'd chosen to go again to the nearby Condumios Taberna at which we had lunched fabulously and cheaply the previous day.

review_preview: This is a difficult review to write because I really wanted to like this place and TA created high expectations.  We'd tried to eat here a couple of times previously, but were not able to get in owing to its small size and popularity, largely...
review_full: This is a difficult review to write because I really wanted to like this place and TA created high expectations. We'd tried to eat here a couple of times previously, but were not able to get in owing to its small size and popularity, largely I think due to the overwhelmingly positive reviews here on TA.  So, to cut to the chase, the high TA ranking and reviews are misleading -- generally I think reading TA reviews are valuable, and I can sort through and identify ones written by individuals who have a good breadth/depth of experience in dining etc. that carry more weight with me to identify good places to try. And I love writing reviews for places I discover that I'm a huge fan of or have a really great experience I want to share. But I must say the ranking here is grossly over-rated and well, undeserved. I think a couple of things are going on here: (1) confirmation bias, i.e., self-validating crowd effect, people read the glowing reviews and really wanting to enjoy/share the fun "discovery" of a very small, quaint but excellent restaurant so they agree with the "herd" and write a great review, (2) the charming owner who appears to personally visit and chat with every table, making it hard to write anything negative, given the restaurant is so small and clearly a very personal endeavor, and (3) the owners' repeated request of diners to write reviews on TA -- we were asked probably no less than 4 times during our meal to do so. I can't recall anywhere else I've eaten where I've been directly asked to write a TA review. I've waited more than a week to write this to separate the "personal" exhortation of the owner/chef from my true evaluation of the food and experience; I too, would likely have ranked it higher if I'd done this review last week, partly out of guilt.  So, my opinion is overall the food is simply average - not bad - just meh; clearly the chef/owner is ambitious and wants it to be more - the presentation is above average, but the execution is middling. We had a wok lomo buried in a cloying, syrupy sauce; the popular brochettes of calamari and shrimp looked great, but it's friend seafood, and have had much better many other places. A merluza entree was just ok. Nothing on the menu is particularly inventive/original. For Spanish/Asian fusion, I'm much more impressed with Yakitoro in Madrid. I'll admit, other dishes we saw served to other tables all looked appetizing - and people seemed to enjoy themselves and devour the food. But we were really left thinking "Huh? What's all the fuss about?" I just can't join the crowd of lemmings to rush in praising this place as one of Madrid's best restaurants - it's not. I can't see it being near the top 50 or even 100. Principally I'm writing this to reset TA readers' expectations -- yes, we enjoyed our meal and would go back, but not at the expense of any great effort to do so in the near term. There's plenty of other restaurants in Madrid I would prefer and prefer to take friends/guests out to. So don't feel you're missing out if you can't score a reservation for this tiny restaurant. Lastly, and not really to pile on, but its NOISY. Essentially a very small "cube" with bare walls. The sound ricochets and really degrades the overall experience. Simple baffles/sound proofing -- or even art on the walls -- could fix some of this. And its size means the seating is squeezed very tight, so how much it impacts your experience likely a factor of your mood/tolerance for both the noise and lack of space between other tables.

It worked well ,and I was pleasantly surprised when Pablo (owner) send me a mail to check and confirm my reservation. Since it was "el classico match" that evening I was worried will I come on time, but it went well. The place itself is small, has only 24 siting places, but it is charming, full of life and not to noisy. We got tiny table near kitchen, but more important it was near Pablo who was welcoming and positive and suggestive. Food was nice, not the best I ever had, but I rarely missed in Spain in such places. Atmosphere was very good, overall felling very good so I would come back again. Dinner for two, bottle of vine, two glasses of Cava app 80 EUR.

I would recommend this restaurant wholeheartedly - it seemed to be popular with locals as well, which is always a good sign.

review_preview: Wow. My wife scouted this place out (on her birthday) on our way back from a Segovia and Escorial day trip. Our reservations were at 10:30 pm. It was still kind of light out when we sat down. Treated like old friends from the get...
review_full: Wow. My wife scouted this place out (on her birthday) on our way back from a Segovia and Escorial day trip. Our reservations were at 10:30 pm. It was still kind of light out when we sat down.  Treated like old friends from the get go---From start to finish by all three of our hosts. Great (inexpensive) wine.  My family (Wife; 13and 16) basically ordered one of everything. Korean dumplings -yowza! Pan-fried/honey glazed Artichoke hearts -- had to have been hand peeled! Fried Canary island cheese with mojo rojo sauce--- increible!!! The dinners were astounding ---  Perfectly seared (and super-fresh) tuna with caramelized red peppers. ?What?!??  Pork with garlic/parsley/Mushrooms perfectly browned and deliciously sauced.  Avila beef with mushrooms. "THAT'S the sauce I want to be able to make" sez the birthday girl! And the HUGE Avila filet (cooked as rare as you want it!) with Pedro Ximenez sherry reduction. Dang!!!! Finished with a completely delicious hand made, warm cinnamon-rollesque type of dessert with vanilla ice cream added. And of course we were treated to a delicious Asturian herbal digestiv to finish.  DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE!! GET RESERVATIONS!! It's TINY! John + Carla June 14 2016

title_review: Little gem hiding in the back streets
review_preview: If we hadn't been recommended by our hotel we probably would have walked straight past this little bar and restaurant. Not being drinkers we could have easily assumed this was just a bar as the dining tables are situated at the back. As we also...
review_full: If we hadn't been recommended by our hotel we probably would have walked straight past this little bar and restaurant. Not being drinkers we could have easily assumed this was just a bar as the dining tables are situated at the back. As we also don't eat red meat we sometimes don't get the red carpet treatment, but not in this case. Our waiters Hoan and Chris couldn't have been more helpful. The goats cheese salad followed by salmon skewers were both delicious and nutritious, a combination sometimes not easy to find in Spain. The desserts were positively sinful but we managed to finish them off. In my opinion both the food and the amazing service by the staff at El Sur were definitely the best in Madrid.

title_review: Very small, nice presentation, well done
review_preview: This restaurant is very small, like 20-30 seats small, and comes with attentive service. Most importantly, it was really, really good. I went here because my colleague is vegan and she knows I still want meat choices. Their menu is not vegan, but they had...

Regardless, she said it was the best meal she had in Madrid, and I will say the same. They change the menu regularly which I like to see. I had grilled octopus which was absolutely done to perfection. Loved it. Both of us had appetizer, main course, bottle of wine, and dessert. Price was more than reasonable. Would highly recommend for fabulous dinner in cozy setting. Excellent.

title_review: Absolutely delicious food with unbelievable service!
review_preview: Definitely one of the best restaurants, if not THE best I have ever eaten at. And I travel quite a bit. The food was absolutely delicious, and good size portions.  There is a lot of options from seafood, to meat, and also some tapas if...
review_full: Definitely one of the best restaurants, if not THE best I have ever eaten at. And I travel quite a bit. The food was absolutely delicious, and good size portions. There is a lot of options from seafood, to meat, and also some tapas if that's what you wanted to try. We had the sorpresa de jamon, as welll as the lomo de ternero con guarniciones. I can't say enough about how amazing these dishes were. As the appetizer, my boyfriend and i shared the Jamon Iberico plate, which was quite a big portion, and super delicious so give it a try! For dessert, we tried the brownie and ice cream which was as delicious as the rest of the meal. Now for the real seller of this restaurant... the incredible service. Our server Ruben has got to be literally the nicest server I have ever had a pleasure of dealing with. He was kind, patient, made us laugh until our stomachs hurt, and was just a magnificent person. He radiates happiness, and shows an unparalleled passion for his job. Wow is all I can say. He took the time to review almost every item on the menu for us because despite us speaking Spanish, we still were not sure what some of the dishes were. He spoke to us about the best places to eat Paella, and gave us recommendations for other places to visit in Spain. Close to the time we were leaving, the restaurant owner spoke to us for close to five minutes about his recent trip to Cuba (where I am from), and made us feel so welcome and happy. Truly an amazing experience. All in all, this restaurant is a MUST in Madrid. It is small, however, so make reservations ahead of time! Please don't miss the opportunity to have amazing food, with super memorable service that will have you leaving with the biggest smile. I will definitely come back to Madrid just for this restaurant in all honesty.

title_review: Rich in flavors and hospitality at La Tragantua! Make a reservation NOW!
review_preview: We are an American family of four (this includes 2 teens) that just ate here tonight. We made our reservation over a month ago and are so glad we did! We ordered the Burratta dish and the Candied Artichokes dish as starters and they were...
review_full: We are an American family of four (this includes 2 teens) that just ate here tonight. We made our reservation over a month ago and are so glad we did! We ordered the Burratta dish and the Candied Artichokes dish as starters and they were different and delicious than anything we have had before (and we are world travelers). The presentation is lovely. The host and servers tended to every need. For our main course we ordered the octopus dish, the french hamburger with goat cheese, the pork beef dish and the diced beef with yellow peppers dish. They were all fantastic. Perfect temperature, fresh ingredients, full of flavor. I highly recommend you make a reservation today for months down the road if you are even just thinking about it! There were many turned away during our time there. They even called us a cab at the end of our meal. It is a tiny venue with about 10 tables max. The dishes ranged in price from 15 euro and up for main dishes. Completely inexpensive compared to fine dining fare in the states. Every bite is worth it!

Our fiends from Madrid who came with us agreed, by the way.

review_preview: Ok, I'm a food snob. As an experienced chef of world cuisine, coming to Spain is like a trip to "Food Mecca". But, still suffering from jet lag, and looking for a quick, inexpensive, meal close to our hotel, my wife and I figured, maybe...
review_full: Ok, I'm a food snob. As an experienced chef of world cuisine, coming to Spain is like a trip to "Food Mecca". But, still suffering from jet lag, and looking for a quick, inexpensive, meal close to our hotel, my wife and I figured, maybe we'll luck out at the recommended "Taberna el Sur." The reviews seemed good and with my Spanish unnecessary for their English speaking staff, we entered the very crowded bar entry with lowered expectations.  Our first surprise was watching the bartender "Poppy" as he expertly crafted a Pisco Sour cocktail with a lovely hand decorated pattern of bitters in its foamy crown and a carved lemon twist smiling from its martini glass rim. He moved on to a Mojito that was equally well done with a veritable bouquet of mint within and without. A very friendly server, Chris the actual head bartender who had entrusted the bar to his able back-up, welcomed us and got us seated pretty quickly. There was a blackboard with a few specials of the day and their brief menu starred with items that were their "winners". Their bread, Chris informed us, was house-made as were their desserts. The listed menu options were all "made from scratch", thus somewhat limited. I smiled at that, knowing that fewer choices are often better when it comes to focused effort towards perfection in a kitchen. I won't bore you with every detail of our meal, but hit a few highlights. Eat the Moussaka! Eat their salads, the Ropa Vieja, Huevos Rotas, Salmon skewers (don't worry that they melt cheese over them, damn it, they're spectacular). Each sauce, for each dish was wonderfully complex and paired beautifully. The presentations could use a little more panache but flavors don't lie. One thing more, we split the salad (Chris' suggestion) but it was plenty for both of us and was dressed with a true, slow reduction balsamic, pickled onion infusion, and fresh orange bits that wowed me. And yes we had cocktails. You betcha! Yes, we had dessert - we split that lime cheese cake and almost cried it was so good, thanks to Vanessa's care, we were told, in bringing us her mother's recipe. Chris topped us off with a complimentary "digustion" of house made melon and vodka that I can still taste! Don't miss this gem. As a matter of fact, we were so happy we went back with our family and had an even better time with Vannessa's brother Alex looking out for us, making great suggestions, and even playing the guitar for a guest as the whole place sang "Happy Birthday" in Spanish! Chris, now behind the bar, masterfully created strawberry flowers to adorn his concoctions and a little complimentary strawberry-puree aperitif for our whole group of new friends as we waited to be seated. The evening ended with similar results; happy and well-fed guests!

title_review: I think we caught them on a bad day
review_preview: The restaurant was obviously having some problems on the day we went for lunch:  A member of the kitchen staff went out twice to buy ingredients at a local market (basics like olive oil), and our server was in a positively nasty mood.  The dishes...
review_full: The restaurant was obviously having some problems on the day we went for lunch: A member of the kitchen staff went out twice to buy ingredients at a local market (basics like olive oil), and our server was in a positively nasty mood. The dishes were generally quite good, with one exception (the sea bass was chock-full of bones, and it was downright oily). The owner was incredibly attentive, but overall it was not the enjoyable experience we had hoped. Still, I believe that was an anomaly on a bad day. The other dishes we ordered were quite good. The menu de l dia was about 14 EUR, including wine and bread, and the standouts were the starters (creamy, savory "red" risotto and a lip-smacking grilled goat cheese salad) and a dessert of mascarpone yogurt and 'fruits of the forest," served in a charming canning jar. My companion's main--pork medallions in mustard-pineapple sauce--was tender and flavorful. The wines were a slight disappointment given the tenor of the restaurant, but I wonder if our server erred: our wines were not what other diners were served. In all, I would give them another try, despite a mildly disappointing experience.

review_preview: After visiting the Prado Museum we tried to have lunch at the nearby Moratin Vinoteca Bistro (based on a #3 rating in Madrid on TripAdvisor), but without reservations we could not get a table. The staff however recommended nearby La Tragantua and it proved to...
review_full: After visiting the Prado Museum we tried to have lunch at the nearby Moratin Vinoteca Bistro (based on a #3 rating in Madrid on TripAdvisor), but without reservations we could not get a table. The staff however recommended nearby La Tragantua and it proved to be a great alternative (living up to it's #16 rating on TripAdvisor). We were offered a vacant table near the kitchen (in a very small restaurant) but gratefully accepted. The amiable staff served my wife and I immediately, and recommended their eggplant and cold tomato soup starters, followed by a sea bass and a risotto main dish. All were excellently and artfully prepared, with wonderful flavors. This set menu (at 14 EU per person) included bread, a glass of good Spanish red wine and a small dessert ... a great value for the quality of food delivered. I highly recommend it.

title_review: Shhh don't tell anyone about this place!!!
review_preview: This is not your normal neighborhood restaraunt.  Now that you've been warned make sure you visit!  At first when you walk in, as an American, you find yourself here in a little different setting.  Its very local in here and dinner is served typically later...
review_full: This is not your normal neighborhood restaraunt. Now that you've been warned make sure you visit!  At first when you walk in, as an American, you find yourself here in a little different setting. Its very local in here and dinner is served typically later than usual for us Yankees. I think we had the first reservation and that wasn't until 730 or 8:30 I can't remember exactly. None of which matters at all because the next 2-3 hours were all fantastic! The place wasn't actually open yet for dinner service when we arrived but the bar was alive with patrons so we helped ourselves to it and had some wine. Both gentlemen working were less than fluent in English but made up for that with their cheery dispositions. At the end of the night it becomes clear to the visitor why they seemed so glad to be at work on a Wed night. After a few glasses we warmed up and so did the place. There are some fun things on the wall in the bar area which led me to believe this was some sort of Italian styled Spanish place so the bar-man explained as best he could that it was and more, much more, with a little Asian influence as well.  Listen, I've already said too much. The bottom line is if you are reading this you can stop now. Just go. Get the chef's tasting menu and take your time and enjoy. The more you enjoy the more this place especially the chef and his creations will enjoy you. And that is why the staff was so happy. Because they know you will happier leaving than whence you came.

review_preview: The bad news: due to a scheduled change by Iberia we were forced to spend the night in Barajas. The good news: we got to dine at Bahia Taverna! What a delightful surprise in Barajas, booked online and hoped for the best for our unplanned...
review_full: The bad news: due to a scheduled change by Iberia we were forced to spend the night in Barajas. The good news: we got to dine at Bahia Taverna! What a delightful surprise in Barajas, booked online and hoped for the best for our unplanned layover. Got a call early on the day we were leaving for Madrid to confirm our dinner reservations for the next evening and suddenly our mood lifted in expectation of a great meal ... we were not disappointed! We reserved for 2000 due to an early flight the next morning, early for us and way too early for Madrid as the kitchen did not even open till 2030. We waited at the bar enjoying a glass of the excellent Privat Cava in the casually elegant restaurant. The front room has high tables reserved for tapas and the rear area facing the open kitchen is set up as the more formal dining area for the degustation menu. Reservations are a must for either room as by 2100 every table was full and it was standing room only at the bar. The crowd is hip and stylish and very, very local as Barajas is a quiet town far from the Madrid city center. The menu was varied and inventive and featured lots of seafood. The unexpected food pairings, all dramatically presented, were a feast for all the senses and we opted for our waiter's excellent recommendations for the wine pairing for each course. We were surprised, tantalized and totally seduced by the spectacular tapas, the excellent wines and the attentive service. Although the restaurant was full there was never a lapse in service, and even the gentleman that called us stopped by to say hello, a very personal touch indeed. We certainly did not expect that one of the finest meals we have ever enjoyed would be in Barajas, we would travel there again when in Madrid just for the pleasure of dining at Bahia Taverna again
